overview:
## Discussion

Use this method to retrieve your app’s default container. This is the one you typically use to store your app’s data. If you want the container for a different app, create a container using the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKContainer/init(identifier:)] method.

During development, the container uses the development environment. When you release your app, the container uses the production environment.

# default()

**Type Method**

Returns the app’s default container.

## Declaration

```swift
class func `default`() -> CKContainer
```

## Discussion

Use this method to retrieve your app’s default container. This is the one you typically use to store your app’s data. If you want the container for a different app, create a container using the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKContainer/init(identifier:)] method.

During development, the container uses the development environment. When you release your app, the container uses the production environment.

## Creating Containers

- **init(identifier:)**: Creates a container for the specified identifier.

items.description: Creates a container for the specified identifier.
items.name: init(identifier:)
